description: It'll be love at first bite when your guests sample these crunchy golden onion bhajis with vibrant coriander yoghurt.
name: Onion Bhajis With Coriander Yoghurt Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 2 tsp Woolworths extra virgin olive oil

recipeInstructions.text: Place onion in a large bowl. Cover with cold water and set aside until needed. Sift flour, baking powder, spices and salt into a second large bowl. Add 2/3 cup cold water, then whisk to form a thick batter.

Drain onion and add to batter. Stir until well combined. Pour enough oil into a large, deep frying pan to come 5mm up side of pan. Heat over medium heat until hot. Working in batches, spoon heaped tablespoonfuls of batter into pan. Cook for 1 1/2 minutes on each side or until golden and cooked through. Using a slotted spoon, transfer to a wire rack set over a paper towel-lined baking tray. Cover loosely to keep warm. Repeat with remaining batter to make a total of 20 bhajis.

To make the coriander yoghurt, reserve a few coriander leaves. Place remaining coriander sprigs, yoghurt, lemon juice and garlic in a small food processor and process until smooth. Season with pepper. Transfer to a small bowl. Drizzle with oil.
Place onion bhajis on a tray and season with pepper. Top with reserved coriander leaves and serve with coriander yoghurt.
